info.title: activities
info.description: This is used to capture task and appointment information.

parameters.name: activities_Id
parameters.description: The value of this parameter could be a hash of the key that is used to uniquely identify the resource item. The client should not generate the hash key value.  Instead, the client should query on the collection resource with a filter to navigate to a specific resource item. For example: products?q=InventoryItemId=<value1>

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2

parameters.name: onlyData
parameters.description: The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

parameters.name: dependency
parameters.description:
This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

parameters.name: links
parameters.description:
This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: totalResults
parameters.description: The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

parameters.name: finder
parameters.description:
Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • PrimaryKey
    Finder Variables:
    • AttachedDocumentId

parameters.name: activities_Id
parameters.description: The value of this parameter could be a hash of the key that is used to uniquely identify the resource item. The client should not generate the hash key value.  Instead, the client should query on the collection resource with a filter to navigate to a specific resource item. For example: products?q=InventoryItemId=<value1>

parameters.name: Upsert-Mode
parameters.description: When set to true, the server will perform an Upsert operation instead of a Create. In an Upsert operation the server attempts to find an existing resource that matches the payload. If found, the server updates the existing resource instead of creating a new one. If not found, or when set to false (the default), a Create is performed.

default.description: The following table describes the default response for this task.

href.title: hyperlink reference
href.description: The URI to the related resource.

rel.title: relation
rel.description: The name of the relation to the resource instance.  Example: self.

changeIndicator.description: Change indicator or the ETag value of the resource instance.

totalResults.description: The estimated row count when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.

count.description: The number of resource instances returned in the current range.

hasMore.description: Indicates whether more resources are available on the server than the subset returned in the response. If the value is true, then there are more resources to retrieve from the server. The default value is false.

limit.description: The actual paging size used by the server.

offset.description: The offset value used in the current page.

links.title: Links
links.description: The link relations associated with the resource instance.
